segment.source: Add rules for packaged apps to existing AppLocker rule-set (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add rules for packaged apps to existing AppLocker rule-set (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes how to update your existing AppLocker policies for packaged apps using the Remote Server Administration Toolkit (RSAT).
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes how to update your existing AppLocker policies for packaged apps using the Remote Server Administration Toolkit (RSAT).

segment.source: Add rules for packaged apps to existing AppLocker rule-set
segment.target: Add rules for packaged apps to existing AppLocker rule-set

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes how to update your existing AppLocker policies for packaged apps using the Remote Server Administration Toolkit (RSAT).
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes how to update your existing AppLocker policies for packaged apps using the Remote Server Administration Toolkit (RSAT).

segment.source: You can create packaged app rules for the computers running Windows Server 2012 or Windows 8 and later in your domain by updating your existing AppLocker rule set.
segment.target: You can create packaged app rules for the computers running Windows Server 2012 or Windows 8 and later in your domain by updating your existing AppLocker rule set.

segment.source: All you need is a computer running at least Windows 8.
segment.target: All you need is a computer running at least Windows 8.

segment.source: Download and install the Remote Server Administration Toolkit (RSAT) from the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: Download and install the Remote Server Administration Toolkit (RSAT) from the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: RSAT comes with the Group Policy Management Console which allows you to edit the GPO or GPOs where your existing AppLocker policy are authored.
segment.target: RSAT comes with the Group Policy Management Console which allows you to edit the GPO or GPOs where your existing AppLocker policy are authored.

segment.source: RSAT has the necessary files required to author packaged app rules.
segment.target: RSAT has the necessary files required to author packaged app rules.

segment.source: Packaged app rules will be ignored on computers running Windows 7 and earlier but will be enforced on those computers in your domain running at least Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8.
segment.target: Packaged app rules will be ignored on computers running Windows 7 and earlier but will be enforced on those computers in your domain running at least Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8.
